instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data: Scrape off all loose, scaling, flaking, and peeling paint manually or by using BOYSEN®® Paint and Varnish Remover B‑141, as necessary. Wash surfaces clean and completely remove chemical residue. Let it dry. In case of mildew infestation, treat with a bleach solution (1:3, laundry bleach to water, respectively) by swabbing or brushing. To ensure proper treatment, let stand for 24 hours before cleaning off residue. Let dry. Surface to be repainted should be clean and dry, free from oil, grease, dust and dirt, and all possible contaminants.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Prime resulting bare wood with BOYSEN®® Flatwall Enamel B‑800. Fully cover the entire surface using BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Undercoat B‑4605 by brush or roller. Let dry for 1 hour before applying the succeeding layer. Mix BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Toner into BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Base B‑4610. A color can be applied in different tones by varying amount of toner used, either Full, One-half, One- Fourth, or any other proportion depending on desired shade. Stir until uniform consistency is achieved. Using a BOYSEN®® DECORe™ brush, apply the prepared BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Base with Toner starting from top corner, working with short crisscrossing strokes. Brush through surface while the paint is still wet to achieve a more uniform pattern. Wait for 8-10 minutes after applying BOYSEN®® DECORe™. Then, lightly comb the surface using the plastic scraper with long crisscrossing strokes, the scraper inclined and close to the surface.

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: Do not thin mixture with water or any solvent. Designs can only be achieved using BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Undercoat. Only use the provided BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Brush and Scraper. The desired finish may not be achieved if a different material is used.
